p: The production of proinflammatory cytokines by AlloStim ®, including IFN-γ and TNF-α, initially activates host NK cells to reject the allogeneic cells, due to missing self-MHC I on the CD4+ AlloStim ® cells. The NK cell compartment is highly stable in terms of function and phenotype in the elderly [ 42] and can therefore readily reject mismatched allogeneic cells. In subsequent ID AlloStim ® injections, the production of IFN-ϒ and expression of CD40L by AlloStim ® activates macrophages that reject the AlloStim ® [ 43]. The rejection of the allogeneic cells by NK cells or macrophages in the skin results in release of endogenous HSP and DAMP danger signals [ 22], which in the context of CD40L and IFN-ϒ expressed by AlloStim ® result in DC maturation to IL-12+ DC1 phenotype and their migration to draining lymph nodes to interact with cognate T-cells to elicit allo-specific Th1/CTL immunity [ 44].
